originalText.text: Champagne and fried chicken. Great combo or an oxymoron?? We obviously got way more than just the bucket list, but I think itâ€™s honestly more an experience and anything else. We tried the tartare trio, golden nugget and the original / soy garlic. Taking a look at their champagne menu is also overwhelming. I think itâ€™s worth coming to, but I donâ€™t know if I would go out of my way. The restaurant itself was fun, and the staff are very welcoming / accommodating. If you get a chance, I think itâ€™s a great weekend treat of Korean elevated fried chicken.

originalText.text:
We arrived at 5pm when it opened, by 5:08 the wait-list was full! We were lucky we had a reservation!
The cocktails were great - jubilee, wilo and white pine rust were solid! If you want the egg you need to get there early as they only sell a limited number per night.
We had the golden 24c nuggets which were a great way to start the meal and paired nicely with our champagne.
All the chicken has an amazing crispy batter which is what makes coqodaq memorable and incredible. We got the bucket list and really enjoyed everything. The garlic soy was my favorite style of sauce.
Dessert was reminiscent of Cote with a soft serve with berry which was tasty.
Staff were super helpful and attentive - almost too attentive. Was great! Will be back;

originalText.text: Chkn was crispy and tasty. I think the restaurant is booked for the next two months. But guess what..I think itâ€™s overrated. Maybe itâ€™s the best fried Chkn ever. Maybe. But it ainâ€™t all that. Either way I had two great cocktails and dinner for just  under $100. So for the price, itâ€™s worth the experience. Wash your hands when you first walk in and when you leave. The soaps.

originalText.text: Food was really great from start to finish. Plenty of wine selection (over 300 I think). Golden nuggets went surprisingly well with the caviar on top. Caesar salad was different but in a good way pairing nicely with the chicken. Tteokbokki resembles more of the authentic korean street style than what you would find in H mart. I definitely recommend trying all three flavors of the chicken as they are each very unique and delicious. They are crispy and yet don't crumble so your table is always clean. Will surely come back to try their cocktails!
